ARABIC: لِّيُنذِرَ مَن كَانَ حَيًّا وَيَحِقَّ ٱلْقَوْلُ عَلَى ٱلْكَٰفِرِينَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: so that you may warn those who are truly alive and so that the Word may be carried out against the kafirun.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So that he may warn him who is alive and feels, and justify the word against those who do not believe.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: that he may warn him who is alive and establish an argument against those that deny the Truth.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: by which he may warn those who are living and may let the words of God come true against the unbelievers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: To warn the living*, and to prove the Word against disbelievers. (Only the believers are deemed alive in Allah’s sight.)
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: That he or it may give warning to him who is living, and that Word may be justified against the disbelievers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: That it may warn him who would have life, and (that) the word may prove true against the unbelievers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: that he may warn whosoever is living, and that the Word may be realized against the unbelievers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: To warn whosoever liveth, and that the word may be fulfilled against the disbelievers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: to warn all who are truly alive, and to justify the word [God's verdict] against the deniers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: In order that it may warn him who is alive, and that the sentence may be justified on the infidels.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: so that anyone who is alive may be warned, and that the word may come due against the faithless.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: That it may give admonition to any (who are) alive, and that the charge may be proved against those who reject (Truth).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: That he or it (Muhammad SAW or the Quran) may give warning to him who is living (a healthy minded the believer), and that Word (charge) may be justified against the disbelievers (dead, as they reject the warnings).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: that he may warn the living, and so that Judgement may be passed against the unbelievers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: That he may warn whoever is alive, and prove the Word against the faithless.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: To warn whoever is alive and justify the word against the disbelievers.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [36:70] that he may warn (li-yundhira; or read li-tundhira, ‘that you may warn’), therewith, whoever is alive, able to comprehend what is being said to him — and such are the believers — and that the Word, of chastisement [from God], may be fulfilled against the disbelievers, who are like the dead, unable to comprehend what is said to them.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (To warn) so that Muhammad (pbuh) warns by means of the Qur'an (whosoever liveth) whoever has an intellect, (and that the word) enjoining wrath and punishment (may be fulfilled against the disbelievers) of Mecca such that they do not believe in Muhammad (pbuh) or in the Qur'an.
